E1LICl64w-easFvNwrWE-g.text: Pretty bad  Food is precious and then warmed up when ordered.  Was drawn in by claims they had slow cooked pork... But sold out by 8 or 8:30.  Since it is precooked, burgers cannot be prepared to order (from what the waitress said they are medium rare).  Settled on the chicken which had little to no flavour even with the onion chutney. Ordered a rum and coke but couldn't taste any rum (although was allegedly a double).  Basically avoid this place at all costs.  I haven't used Yelp in a couple years but downloaded the app to write this review.  That is how bad my meal was.

WaoP0iKBFEA1vpk4YA4SjQ.text: Very cute place with rustic theme decoration. Quite busy, if you don't want to wait call earlier.  we ordered plates to share and they were amazing!  First we ordered a baked camembert cheese (amazing), English platter (amazing except the scotch egg), quinoa raspberry cake. The restaurant serves British style with a twist.  We also received a voucher for free treat (red velvet cupcake / coffee / glass of house wine) for our next visit. Call and reserve for the table with swing!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Baked Camembert Cheese
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. English platter for sharing
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Quinoa (with cranberry) cake

DAb9qQ86LxcIiToF0RCOFA.text: Came for the afternoon tea which I have to say, was a really disappointing experience. The staff however were extremely accommodating and friendly. We came early for our booking and they were really kind in finding us a table in spite of a quite full restaurant. When the afternoon tea arrived it looked just like the picture in the homepage - inviting and delicious. Unfortunately the lovely display was just for show. The sandwiches were dry, the tea lukewarm and the cakes were uninteresting. The best part was the brownie bite (not bites - as there were only one) which was quite nice and chocolate rich. The sandwich filling was completely lacking taste.  So unfortunately the food was a boring experience. The restaurant itself had a lovely decor- very bright and welcoming. Another thing we found extremely annoying was the sound level of the music. It was so loud it actually made it impossible to have a conversation. Looking at the constant flow of guests I hope we were just unlucky with our food - however that made our visit quite disappointing and I will not be returning. With such a vast number of lovely eateries in London I see no reason to return to a place which in my view was at best mediocre.

dhL3vxRnXtXp2ItxsxMf0A.text: What a gem this place is!Got taken here by a fellow lawyer, and I was amazed at the homely feel of this place. The plates are very cute as well, felt like they would suit a Cathy Kidson store. Decoration is simple but very pleasant.We were a party of 3 and shared a breakfast type platter with scotch egg, cheese, bread and some other ingredient which I have unfortunately forgotten now. The scotch egg is my highlight so far, it's very light and melty inside and I was a happy bunny. It was huge as well, I ate only a quarter!!We ordered a slice of carrot cake and it was massive, 3x the normal small ish cakes you would get in other cafes, and it also did not disappoint, it was soo nice. There is no more reason to go to Paul and fight with the crowd in there anymore. This place is so much more pleasant and the food and much more worth it.They serve arizona peach ice tea, this is an amazing drink...I'm looking into sourcing this for my home...heheheheSpoke to a friend about this place, they said there is a table with swings here, not noticed this but next time I'm definitely checking it out.

alpdj4jJ6upOXaCS6pOM6Q.text: What a lovely spot for a lunch, cup of tea or cake. Disappointingly however, I have to say on both my visits (lunch and breakfast) the venue and decor was a lot better than the food. This is not to say the food was particularly bad but neither was it of a standard to match the effort they have put into the ambience, which is a great shame.The lack of effort they put into the food is probably a symptom of getting enough tourist trade that the quality of food does not have to attract repeat business.The place is usually pretty quiet for breakfast during the week but very busy for brunch and lunch at the weekend. The décor makes it a pleasant place to spend an hour if you are stopping for a cake or coffee but expect average food if you need something a bit more filling.

l_XQihKQ_OQ6Q1Av9ok2Lg.text: I'm a tourist fm San Francisco (which says that I'm frequently spoiled by good food) and I must say this place is a gem! The ambiance is simply amazing, the food is great and the service is superb :) we were sitting at the table by the window and the theme is like a garden setting where our chairs are those lil swings you would only see in those fancy backyards in the movies. As we were enjoying our dinner we were swinging with the beat of the music they were playing (good selection btw). One of the most relaxing dinners I have had. This place is way too cute to be true and I just felt in love instantly. I'll attach pictures for you all to see just to prove my point ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

uBpHIN-15J36BsT71FYtfA.text: Just random choice of the food but they all taste really good! Pumpkin soup and salad. Well managed, cool staffs.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Pumkin soup, salad and bread
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. View from window
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Down stair

n1tTE_ZZ1r1Q1zm7pEi9Fg.text: Walking past made me completely intrigued. Going in made completely 'un-intrigued'. The interior looks cute, but doesn't feel that way. It's not comfortable or cosy.. It feels like big fake charade to me. Even the numerous plants are fake... They say they are modern European, but don't even serve Fresh mint tea. In fact, even don't know what it is..The service is too much in your face/back/everywhere. Never thought I would ever say this, but they were too attentive. Or maybe not even attentive, but kind of all over you.In terms of the food - well, it wasn't bad, but nothing breath taking or wonderful... Nothing that would invite me back.. Reminded me of school dinners, but ok tasting. Especially when I got pieces of turkey cut on precise thin slices. Call me crazy, but I think there is something wrong about uniform looking food.. It's getting potatoes in separate bowl etc.. As petty as it might seem, when all those little details come together it just feels off.. Oh, I've almost forgotten.. This place is the kingdom of fakery and pretends... I got it now...

lQ9TuQSIvT_Uxgt1HN8PUw.text: We have been here in a Saturday evening. Despite the many waiters the service was a mess. The food came after ages and the English starter platter was horrible (like a meal from Green Monday. . . ) we paid 20 pounds each.The two stars are for the taste of the food and the great decoration.

uvTegOlki90OQuQpd6Z7SQ.text: Lunch with butternut squash soup, pork sliders, quinoa cake, and a salad of feta, spinach, squash. Excellent visual presentation as well as taste. Great service.

fuw0nsdFBlQaDo88TpdZvA.text: This is my first review (hope not the last on Yelp)Nice atmosphere cozy and comfortable!Nice dishes , Great Service ,Cute decoration Ps. We order Benedict & Florentine

oScDdRwLm6Lw5Ve4-4Okvg.text: This place is very cute. The food is good, but nothing special. The service was off: the eggs I ordered were cooked sunny side up even though I requested them scrambled. They fixed it, but then I was charged for two meals. They fixed that too.

oSzMzHE7cu75INTHdhuEfw.text: The only reason I am giving them 1 star is because that is the lowest Yelp will allow me to rate it. I was honestly really excited to go to Muriel's for afternoon tea. We got a reservation at 6pm and waited to be served. It took about 15-20 minutes for the tray to come and many of the pastries that were advertised were replaced with others. I understand that we got a late reservation but they should have told us that they were replacing them. I'm not so annoyed with the initial wait and replacement of pastries as I am with the service, or lack there of, when we tried to leave. The waiters completely ignored us when we tried to ask for the bill! We asked multiple times to get the bill and were repeatedly told that it would be printed out soon. We were sitting right next to the cash register! The waitress we asked printed out 3 different bills for other tables during our wait. A transaction that could have taken 3-5 mins was prolonged to 20-30 minutes. The servers completely neglected us since we were a party of two and they felt they wouldn't get tipped. I just don't understand why they would not let me pay?! Horrible service!! I would never go back and I greatly advise small parties to stay clear of this place.

oBpLcmiEw45SrGi762u-zA.text: Very stylish restaurant. I find it a little overpriced, also with most of the dishes you need to order the sides separately. I find that a little silly. I like to have a complimentary side paired to the dish, if it's down to me I have chips with everything which sometime may not be the best choice. I love the decor, and it's a definitely go to for coffee and cake, but as a restaurant it failed for me. The food feels a little mass produced... It may just be my impression.

1WqPQ3epQHFFaFNY3SH-DQ.text: Bland and mediocre but nice ambiance and service. Burger tastes just like a Big Mac from mcd's, you decide if that is good or bad. Pizza was bland mostly but it has hints of greatness which it ultimately fails to achieve.

RH1HbXoWvx9XJ3LFNTtguw.text: If you are visiting in the winter time all I have to say is get the mulled wine. It is out of this world and the desserts are great too. We also stopped in for breakfast one morning and everyone enjoyed why they got.

DDlN_JR1uqs-WZSq5ghtYw.text: Really liked the place... Went there twice for breakfast. Tried the egg and the pankakes and it was delicious. A bit pricey but the service is great and the design of the place is amazing! The breakfast size is small-medium.

KSZj7rhiGDG2gETx3fQWrA.text: Tourist trap.  This place upholds the English tradition of bad English food.  The window dressing  looks great so I went inside - on holiday in London for a week.  Ordered traditional English breakfast.  Practically inedible. The toast was hard as a rock, eggs looked and tasted gross, a vile 'sausage' and pure lard bacon.  If it was not my first (and only) meal that day I would have left.  I asked for a glass of water - got lukewarm water.  If I wanted ice water it would have cost 2.50 BP. All in all - Revolting. And cash or Visa only.

_Hc37Ea98iry1JxJ7_VsaA.text: Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, good food BUT the service was horrendously slow. 45+ min wait for a few eggs is ridiculous.

skFpO_TEG6fTJvS4Mxf_uA.text: I've been to this location of Muriel's twice. The first visit, patrons on either side of my table were compensated with free meals by the manager since their orders were unacceptably slow to the table. Today's visit, I arrived before 14:00 (brunch is served until then), but when I ordered, the server said they couldn't accommodate brunch orders any more today as the kitchen was too slow and customers were getting upset. Glad their kitchen is busy, but it's hardly okay to not be able to serve your clientele.

6DeVCoDh1nYcUKQ2JSbNqQ.text: Solid comfort food. Had lasagna which was good and filling, but was a bit too oily. Matcha latte was nice as well

7uRR1G73po8jj0QvbR2pIg.text: Came in got afternoon tea, and it was a very pleasant, and surprisingly affordable experience. We spent less than £40 for two people, and felt it was a great value.The serving comes on a beautiful wooden bench, with sweets and scones on the sides, and the sandwiches on the top. The sandwiches were scrumptious. Salmon, avocada, chicken, and egg salad; I could shove these down my mouth all day long. Yum!The scones were also phenomenal, fresh tasting and served with a scrumptious clotted cream and strawberry jam.The sweets were just ok in my view. There were a few mousse/jello type desserts we didn't care for, and the mince pie and pound cake were also unremarkable but fine.There is a selection of about 6 or so teas to choose from. Everyone also gets a min berry smoothie.The ambience in the restaurant is perfect for afternoon tea. Rustic, cozy, and laid-back, it was very pleasant to sip tea here. One more thing checked off in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea. Couldn't get a great pic because it is quite dark inside.

Y1ILSm71MdvOnLXayIZ3mA.text: What a cute restaurant! I was sightseeing in the area and popped in for breakfast before starting a long day of sightseeing. The service was extraordinary, I was so impressed!The prices are good, and the food is quality and really tasty! I had the Buddha bowl with the jalapeño yogurt sauce and it was perfect. Filling, healthy, and delicious! So happy to have found Muriel's!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

lDNSbD4ksqw14u2RvaJLwg.text: This place was recommended to me. And boy, it did not dissappoint! Awesome place, lovely interor style, friendly and helpful staff and the food was just delicious. I had the Popeye Breakfast (for 8.50£) and a yummy cappuccino, followed by a green juice (apple, cucumber, celery, spinach, mint). I would highly recommend this place!

c2vLAXtKRekQPZzODvDFkw.text: Beautiful deco inside makes for a very attractive brunch spot. I can see why the popularity. Food was good, could have seen better portions for the prices!

86NrikQUY38vezIDaPvu_w.text: Omg first time here I loved it! The food was great and the service was impeccable. I ordered the burger but the best part of it were the crunchy french fries! Also the tomato bruschetta was amazing and freshly made. The place was also clean and the ambience was chill. Definitely somewhere to go for brunch.

j6LCeoRePSYV5oABYr_9jQ.text: Ideal place for brunch - cute decorations, lovely breakfast menu. Very popular though so it gets crowded easily.

iXlKdvCiPL-LjfB1aZbx0w.text: Came here for breakfast. Food was really good. Got a traditional English breakfast and a tea. Fiancé got an eggs Benedict with salmon, also good.Fast service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

iG_XaTi2uu51XfYgslkhpg.text: We ordered the mozzarella bruschetta, scotch egg, and carrot cake. All of them were amazing! It is very clean and spacious inside and the staff was so friendly. I fed recommend for even just a quick bite in like we had!

psjE3UkZPvUcIc7XHRf1uQ.text: The decor in this place is beautiful - it's light, summery and super girly. I'd say the food is also aimed at those with a delicate / feminine palate as its heavy on the salads and light on the carbs. I enjoyed a 'combination plate' of salad, which is a choice of 4 salads for £9.99. This included butternut squash and feta, smoked aubergine, winter slaw and carrot and kale salad. The portions are massive and I must say I got a bit bored halfway through. There's a limit to how much salad a girl can eat!However, it's great value for money, service is swift and it was bright and empty. If you're into healthy food with lots of gluten free and vegan options you'll love it as much as my friend did. If not, you'll still love the prices as £9.99 for a decent sized meal is great value in the Soho area.

-GE4yvO5n0MYoJZkpTU1Kw.text: A delightful place this is.A good starting point for your Sunday brunch, morning breakfast and casual retreat for coffee, buns, cakes and whatnot with friends.They say first impressions count more than most other things. The feeling you get when you look in from the outside, and more importantly when you walk in do in this case hit all the right spots. Cozy, friendly and with a bit of grandma's love, this is a simple yet extremely welcoming place.I've only come here for mid morning breakfast on a weekend, when coffee rules the first few hours of my day and am less inclined to indulge in a feast. For this, it did what I wanted, they provided decent coffee (Southern Europeans may look away now as it might not be up to their standards) and some delightfully yummy morning grub, including some lovely buns, sandwich and viennoiserie. I'm one for a juice in the morning and their energy packed fresh juices really do go down well.Overall, I'd go again, especially when the cold is present and the weather uninspiring for anything but indoor activities.Oh, and they do wifi which is great to share a shot of yourself on social enjoying the warmth, the food and the drinks.

3Apd7GUSRC7yDiG2ISX1Jw.text: When here for tea and cake with a friend after an exhibition trip. I love tea and cake, so most places that bring me what I want, it's tasty, and without dropping it are going to get a pretty high score from me. Staff were pleasant but a little flustered, tea was lovely, and the cake was the size of bunting flags- definitely recommended for cake!

beLJet4gNH9BEdYmiAPe-Q.text: We came into this place after lunch at a different restaurant with the intention of grabbing coffee and desserts. On approach we weren't confident as we were a group of 6 and they looked busy. However when we got to the door we were promptly seated and told that just ordering coffee and cakes were fine!The restaurant is much bigger inside than it appears and it has a fresh welcoming decor, think summer park! The seats are well placed and there are spaces for groups or couples.We ordered a selection of desserts accompanied with either coffee or smoothies. The deserts were really good, generous portions (great to share) and very tasty. The drinks were all well made and it all turned up pretty quickly.The service was also very attentive, we were well looked after without being pressured. I took a quick look over the menu while I was in, and plan on coming back to try some of the very reasonable prices salads!

O69rXSwTeBRjwaffbtGumA.text: Good breakfastI had the avocado dish on a toast and Gil had the Steak and eggs. Both were good. Lovely bloody marry and coffee.

_cW_TMUU7atbIxXz1le9fg.text: Cute decor with ok food. Don't see why the lasagna is "famous" and the service was a bit dodgy.

h5F5XFMdfo2sv9hrr_4XZg.text: This place is super cute, and the food is good. Not sure why it's not four star. Me and my friends had brunch here and we had so much fun, felt like we were sitting in a nice living room. I had their omelette.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

DUbMmUHnnZwcR_vcqCpSpw.text: This restaurant has so much potential but unfortunately did not deliver this time...  We had a lovely table outside in the sun for breakfast.  To took a looong time for a waitress to offer us menus and drinks.  That would normally be acceptable if the restaurant is busy, they were not.  Eventually we received out coffees and order breakfasts.  The food looked promising but sadly not cooked properly!  What is worse than a raw pancake!  I can also not say the cheese croissant looked very appetising.  Neither was worth the cals!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Raw pancake :-(
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

1HfRPM72Xw0IZ9xxYV5Jmw.text: Summary based on one late weekday breakfast:--tried this place out instead of my normal, nearby Patisserie Valerie.--ok service--not that great food. Over seasoned porridge. Missing one of the listed ingredients in my companion's dish.--a little more expensive than warranted--pleasant enough ambiance, but tables are too close togetherThere are better choices in the area

htWLC4Mdw1gqtcYLyPZ61Q.text: Lovely decorated place. It truly looks like "grandma's kitchen/living room", which is their whole point Be it that you're looking for a roomy table, an elegant one, a comfy sofa o some fairy swinging chairs!. Food was tasty, portions are big and lavish, wether you want to plenty your stomach or just grab a piece of cake & tea. This is the place. I went there last Sunday afternoon, and the place was packed. However the atmosphere was still enchanting, and the staff very friendly. Music too loud though, I had to raise my voice to talk to my friend next to me.

i-W62wQ622sZXCbp4ox-Gg.text: Nice place with great interiors. Feels just like someone's kitchen. Food is a bit random and was ok but not fantastic. It's a bit pricey but it's tourist central so they can get away with it! Worth a visit for a cup of tea and a slice of cake but that's about it!
